\section{Views}
\label{\detokenize{cart:views}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cart management features: adding, deleting and viewing.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!cart.views@\spxentry{cart.views}}\index{cart.views@\spxentry{cart.views}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{add\_to\_cart() (in module cart.views)@\spxentry{add\_to\_cart()}\spxextra{in module cart.views}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{cart:module-cart.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{cart:cart.views.add_to_cart}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cart.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_to\_cart}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{item\_id}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{item\_type}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add a curriculum or lesson item to the user’s shopping cart stored in session.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Validations:
\sphinxhyphen{} Prevent adding items already purchased.
\sphinxhyphen{} Prevent adding duplicate items.
\sphinxhyphen{} Prevent mixing curriculum with its individual lessons in cart or purchases.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{request}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{HttpRequest}}) \textendash{} The POST request containing user session and data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{item\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The ID of the curriculum or lesson to add.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{item\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} ‘curriculum’ or ‘lesson’.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Redirects to ‘next’ URL if valid, else to cart page with appropriate messages.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
HttpResponseRedirect

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Views}
\label{\detokenize{certificates:module-certificates.views}}\label{\detokenize{certificates:views}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!certificates.views@\spxentry{certificates.views}}\index{certificates.views@\spxentry{certificates.views}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{view\_certificate() (in module certificates.views)@\spxentry{view\_certificate()}\spxextra{in module certificates.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{certificates:certificates.views.view_certificate}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{certificates.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{view\_certificate}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{theme\_id}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Displays a user’s certificate for a given theme if eligible.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If the user has not completed all lessons in the theme’s curriculums,
a page indicating they are not eligible for the certificate is shown.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{request}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{HttpRequest}}) \textendash{} The incoming HTTP request.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{theme\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The ID of the theme for which to display the certificate.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The certificate page or the “not eligible” page.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
HttpResponse

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Middleware}
\label{\detokenize{core:module-core.middleware}}\label{\detokenize{core:middleware}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!core.middleware@\spxentry{core.middleware}}\index{core.middleware@\spxentry{core.middleware}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{CurrentUserMiddleware (class in core.middleware)@\spxentry{CurrentUserMiddleware}\spxextra{class in core.middleware}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{core:core.middleware.CurrentUserMiddleware}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.middleware.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CurrentUserMiddleware}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{get\_response}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Middleware that stores the current user in a thread\sphinxhyphen{}local variable.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This allows access to the current user from anywhere in the code
(e.g., models, signals, utils) without explicitly passing the request object.
\index{get\_response (core.middleware.CurrentUserMiddleware attribute)@\spxentry{get\_response}\spxextra{core.middleware.CurrentUserMiddleware attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{core:core.middleware.CurrentUserMiddleware.get_response}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_response}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
The next middleware or view to call.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
callable

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

Abstract base model that adds user tracking fields to log which user created or last modified the object.

\sphinxAtStartPar
created\_by (ForeignKey): The user who created the object.
updated\_by (ForeignKey): The user who last modified the object.

\end{description}

\index{certificate\_set (courses.models.Theme attribute)@\spxentry{certificate\_set}\spxextra{courses.models.Theme attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures

{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{certificate\_set}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a
many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one relation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Parent.children}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ReverseManyToOneDescriptor}} instance.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager
class built by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_forward\_many\_to\_many\_manager()}} defined below.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{curriculums (courses.models.Theme attribute)@\spxentry{curriculums}\spxextra{courses.models.Theme attribute}}

{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{curriculums}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a
many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one relation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Parent.children}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ReverseManyToOneDescriptor}} instance.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager
class built by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_forward\_many\_to\_many\_manager()}} defined below.

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Views}
\label{\detokenize{dashboard:module-dashboard.views}}\label{\detokenize{dashboard:views}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!dashboard.views@\spxentry{dashboard.views}}\index{dashboard.views@\spxentry{dashboard.views}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{dashboard() (in module dashboard.views)@\spxentry{dashboard()}\spxextra{in module dashboard.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dashboard:dashboard.views.dashboard}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dashboard.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{dashboard}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Render the user’s dashboard displaying their purchased curriculums and lessons,
along with their completion progress organized by themes and curriculums.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This view performs the following steps:
\sphinxhyphen{} Retrieves all successful payments for the logged\sphinxhyphen{}in user.
\sphinxhyphen{} Identifies purchased curriculums and individually purchased lessons.
\sphinxhyphen{} Fetches lessons completed by the user.
\sphinxhyphen{} Organizes individually purchased lessons by theme and curriculum,
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
including whether each lesson is purchased and/or completed.
\end{quote}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates progress percentages for themes based on completed lessons.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Lists curriculums purchased by the user within each theme,
computing progress per curriculum and overall theme progress.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Passes structured data to the ‘dashboard/dashboard.html’ template for rendering.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Context passed to the template:
\sphinxhyphen{} ‘theme\_with\_curriculums’: List of themes with their curriculums,
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
each curriculum annotated with purchase status and progress percentage.
\end{quote}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‘standalone\_lessons\_by\_theme’: Dict mapping themes to their curriculums
and lessons bought individually, with purchase and completion flags.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‘completed\_lessons\_ids’: IDs of lessons marked as completed by the user.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‘theme\_progress\_by\_theme’: Progress percentage of completed lessons per theme for purchased curriculums.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‘standalone\_progress\_by\_theme’: Progress percentage of completed individually purchased lessons per theme.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Requires user authentication.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{request}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{HttpRequest}}) \textendash{} The HTTP request object.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Rendered dashboard page with user’s learning progress and purchases.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
HttpResponse

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\sphinxstepscope

\index{create\_checkout\_session() (in module payments.views)@\spxentry{create\_checkout\_session()}\spxextra{in module payments.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{payments:payments.views.create_checkout_session}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{payments.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_checkout\_session}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Creates a Stripe Checkout session for the items in the cart stored in the session.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Accepted method: POST only.
Retrieves the items from the user’s session cart, creates a Stripe session with these items,
and returns the Stripe session ID to the frontend.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns HTTP 400 if the method is not POST or if the cart is empty.

\end{fulllineitems}

Includes additional fields such as \sphinxtitleref{is\_client}, \sphinxtitleref{is\_admin}, and \sphinxtitleref{email\_verified}.
Inherits auditing features from AuditableMixin.

\index{certificate\_created\_by (users.models.CustomUser attribute)@\spxentry{certificate\_created\_by}\spxextra{users.models.CustomUser attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{certificate\_created\_by}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a
many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one relation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Parent.children}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ReverseManyToOneDescriptor}} instance.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager
class built by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_forward\_many\_to\_many\_manager()}} defined below.

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{CustomUserManager (class in users.models)@\spxentry{CustomUserManager}\spxextra{class in users.models}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{users:users.models.CustomUserManager}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{users.models.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CustomUserManager}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseUserManager}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Custom manager for the CustomUser model based on email authentication.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Provides methods to create regular users and superusers without a username field,
using only the email address for identification.
